definition: to appeal (to reason, sentiment, charity etc)/to resort to (a course of action)

sentences.english: The issue remains that the other South-asian countries have the rights to claim these territories.
sentences.chinese: 南亚的其他国家也有权诉诸对南沙群岛的主权。

sentences.english: The main argument relativists appeal to is that of tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 相对主义者主要诉诸的论据是宽容。

sentences.english: If other means fail , we shall resort to force.
sentences.chinese: 如果其他手段均失败，我们就将诉诸武力。

sentences.english: Its pleadings will not bear to be stereotyped.
sentences.chinese: 它的诉诸同情的方法不能一成不变。

sentences.english: In the meantime, try changing positions and suing heat to relieve it.
sentences.chinese: 同时，试着改变姿势和诉诸热度来缓解它。

sentences.english: That change is then carried into the wider world.
sentences.chinese: 这样的改变将会诉诸于更宽广的世界。

sentences.english: Sino-Forest hasn't said whether they plan to go to court.
sentences.chinese: 嘉汉林业还未表示他们是否计划诉诸法庭。

sentences.english: It is a rare skill for a doctor to be able to communicate this rich sensorium in writing.
sentences.chinese: 但能把这种丰富的感觉诉诸笔端的医生却并不多见。

sentences.english: We appealed to reason to win our argument.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠诉诸于理性赢得了辩论。

sentences.english: The covenant of the league of nations bound all signatory states not to go to war .
sentences.chinese: 国际联盟盟约规定，所有签字国都不得诉诸战争。

sentences.english: Less should countries willfully resort to force in tackling energy issues.
sentences.chinese: 处理能源问题不能任意诉诸武力。

sentences.english: China is probably extremely wary of resorting to force.
sentences.chinese: 中国对于诉诸武力非常敏感。

sentences.english: They felt obliged to resort to force .
sentences.chinese: 我们不排除诉诸武力的可能性。

sentences.english: They (the supporters) have the right to demand results but not to resort to violence.
sentences.chinese: 他们有权希望球队取得好成绩，但也别诉诸暴力啊。

sentences.english: The covenant of the League of Nations bound all signatory states not to go to war.
sentences.chinese: 规定，所有签字国都不得诉诸战争。

sentences.english: Perpend, and do not compel me to use violence.
sentences.chinese: 注意，不要逼我诉诸武力。

definition: to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
(conventional letter ending) words cannot fully express what is in my heart (idiom)
to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
